article.headline: Troy State 120, Campbell 82
article.story: TROY, Ala. (AP) -- Rob Lewin scored 21 points and grabbed eight rebounds and five others scored in double figures to lead Troy State to a 120-82 rout of Campbell on Wednesday night. Lewin, who scored the bulk of his points in the first half, hit 8 of 12 from the field and was 5-of-5 in free throws. Kendrick Johnson scored 19 points for the Trojans (13-5, 9-2 Atlantic Sun Conference), while Zavier Mathis added 18. Ryan Heck and Greg Davis each scored 14 points and Jerome Stamper finished with 10. Troy State scored 60 points in each half and had a 23-point advantage at halftime. The Camels (1-17, 1-10) cut the deficit to 18 points with 17:30 remaining, but Johnson answered with three back-to-back hits from 3-point range. Mathis followed minutes later with a pair of 3-pointers, pushing the lead to 85-57 and the Camels never caught up. Tarick Johnson led the Camels with 16 points and 16 boards, while Dominique Klein added 13. Colin Hunt and Anthony Atkinson scored 12 and 11, respectively. Campbell outrebounded the Trojans 52-39, but was held to 37 percent shooting. The Trojans hit 51 percent of their shots and scored 24 points off Campbell's 20 turnovers.
